intro: Mallotus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive mallot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its name "deceptive mallot" may refer to its ability to mimic other plants or its misleading appearance.
